meanings.definition: Ethnomethodologists: Researchers who study the methods people use to make sense of their everyday social interactions.
meanings.sent1: Ethnomethodologists observe how people understand their daily conversations.
meanings.sent2: The ethnomethodologists conducted a study on social interaction patterns.
meanings.sent3: The ethnomethodologists had a good laugh while analyzing social behaviors.
meanings.sent4: In their research, ethnomethodologists peel back the layers of social norms.
meanings.sent5: The work of ethnomethodologists sheds light on human interaction complexities.
